intro: Lithocarpus boholensis, commonly known as the Bohol stone栎, is a member of the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and chestnuts. It is a large evergreen tree native to the Philippines, particularly found in the island of Bohol. The plant is characterized by its hard, woody fruit, which is often used in traditional medicine. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and arranged alternately along the branches. The species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
